channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Street lamp no5 still not working, 20th November
item.description:
Outside no131 village road, Cheltenham..... street lamp no5 is still not working.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 147, Village Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The trees along this road are particularly big, 20th November
item.description:
Bradley road Alongside 24b croft gardens but actually on the other side of the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8, Garden Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is leaning into the narrow road forcing drivers to swerve, 20th November
item.description:
There is a tree on the left side of the lane as you drive from the Southam end into Cleeve. This tree is just after the chicane and is leaning into the road (I think the bus/vans keep catching it and pulling it further out of the hedgerow). It's forcing cars to swerve round it which is dangerous on a narrow lane and if you can't swerve, it damaging vehicles.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kayte Lane, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pot holes at junction of croft street, 20th November
item.description:
This week you resurfaced croft street ( the Workmans loo is still there ) , a side road, and decided not to resurface the more important section on leckhampton road that has had multiple poor repairs. The workman stood within feet of this area, with a lovely big road machine, but nope it's been decided not to do it at the same time. this part of leckhampton road receives regular visits and is now an amazing patchwork of un even tarmac, dispersed with a selection of new holes. cyclists not have to head for the middle of the road or risk being thrown off

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 48, Leckhampton Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two potholes in quick sucession along Chosen Drive, 20th November
item.description:
Near the properties of Bluebell Cottage and Windy Corner both on the left hand side (Windy Corner Side of road)
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chosen Drive, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects - Vegetation problem, 20th November
item.description:
NWD WITH GIVE AN TAKE PLUS TEMPORARY FOOTWAY CLOSURE NEEDED PLEASE CUT BACK overhanging brambles and vegetation restricting the footway back to wall boundary appropriately 13 meters x 3 meters (Overgrown Hedge)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trees preventing the street light from illuminating a dark back alley, 20th November
item.description:
The back alley that connects Meteor Way to Ermin Street. Roughly behind/alongside 8 Meteor Way, GL3 4UU. Makes walking that path quite dark or feel a bit unsafe.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 143, Ermin Street, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overhanging trees, 20th November
item.description:
A Gloucestershire highways van attended yesterday, but the majority of the branches are still overhanging onto the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Overton Park Road, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
